data.text:
Homeru Hito Homerareru Hito

Date: From 10.45 p.m., Mondays – Thursdays, 12 June 2023

Station: NHK

Original Work: Homeru Hito Homerareru Hito by Takeda Nozomu

Scriptwriter: Fujiki Mitsuhiko (Saisho wa Paa, Byplayers Series, Asunaro San San Nana Byoushi)

Directors: Okada Ken, Kasaura Tomochika, Tanaka Kenji, Kaji Genichiro

Cast: Morikawa Aoi, Kawasaki Takaya, Noro Kayo, Hayama Shono, Masana Bokuzo, Sekiguchi Mandy, Kanno Rio, Sano Hiroki, Mimura Akari, Shimizu Michiko, Ibu Masato, Hamada Mari, Takemori Sento, Dronzu Ishimoto, Asagaya Shimai

Synopsis: 25-year-old Ichikawa Eiko (Morikawa Aoi) works for the general affairs department. She normally does not get much appreciation even if she does her job properly. But when she makes a slight mistake, she gets thoroughly scolded. A senior colleague Bando Hajime (Kawasaki Takaya) suddenly starts trying to compliment and cheer her up after hearing her dejectedly mutter that she wants to be praised. However, his choice of words are quite unusual such as likening her enthusiasm to the Nebuta Festival. Eiko thought she would not feel happy but strangely enough, his strange compliments start to comfort her and their communication inspires all sorts of miracles in the general affairs department and across the company.

Website: www.nhk.jp/p/ts/39LJQWGN7Y

Twitter: twitter.com/nhk_dramas

Manatsu no Cinderella

Date: From 9.00 p.m., Mondays, 10 July 2023

Station: Fuji TV

Genre: Romance

Scriptwriter: Shito Sayaka

Director: Tanaka Ryo

Cast: Mori Nana, Mamiya Shotaro, Kamio Fuju, Yoshikawa Ai, Hagiwara Riku, Shirahama Aran, Nimura Sawa, Mizukami Koshi, Morisaki Win, Sakurai Yuki (guest star), Yamaguchi Tomomitsu, Onishi Riku

Synopsis: Aoi Natsumi (Mori Nana), a cheerful, spirited stand-up paddle surfing instructor, was born and grew up by the seaside. She enjoys hanging out with her two girlfriends Airi and Risa (Yoshikawa Ai, Nimura Sawa), has a kind heart and puts her family (Yamaguchi Tomomitsu, Onishi Riku) first. Mizushima Kento (Mamiya Shotaro) who graduated from a top university and works for a major architecture firm in Tokyo, is like the model student. He wanted to be a marine biologist but went along with his parents’ expectations because his father is a famous architect. However, his feelings start to change after a chance encounter with Natsumi in summer.

Website: www.fujitv.co.jp/natsu_cin

Twitter: twitter.com/natsu_cin

Tenshoku no Maousama

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Mondays, 17 July 2023

Station: Fuji TV

Genre: Corporate

Original Work: Tenshoku no Maousama Series by Nukaga Mio

Scriptwriters: Izumisawa Yoko (Bengoshi Sodom, Guilty, Dairenai), Komine Hiroyuki (Giver Taker, Kokucho no Mizuumi, Anonymous)

Directors: Horie Takahiro, Maruya Shunpei, Hosaka Shoichi

Cast: Narita Ryo, Koshiba Fuka, Yamaguchi Sayaka, Fujiwara Taiyu, Oideyasu Oda, Maeda Goki, Inoue Shota, Imoto Ayaka, Ishida Yuriko

Synopsis: Career adviser Kurusu Arashi (Narita Ryo) from an outplacement agency called Shepherd Career uses a cane because he cannot walk well with his limp left leg. A top performer who has been given the nickname “Devil of Job Changes”, he unleashes blistering remarks that breaks the hearts of jobseekers. Although his words are blunt, he cuts through worries about their job and life, getting to the heart of the matter and helping restore their confidence and hope. Hitsujitani Chiharu (Koshiba Fuka) becomes his partner. She had joined a major advertising agency right out of university but ended up quitting in less than three years due to the difficult work environment. Intending to look for a new job, she paid a visit to Shepherd Career, which is run by her aunt Yoko (Ishida Yuriko). That is how she met Kurusu. He is able to uncover what happened at her previous workplace and what she really thinks.

Website: www.ktv.jp/tenshokumao

Twitter: twitter.com/tenshokumao

Watashi no Ichiban Saiakuna Tomodachi*UPDATED*

Date: From 10.45 p.m., Mondays – Thursdays, 21 August 2023

Station: NHK

Episodes: 32

Scriptwriters: Hyodo Ruri, Fukino Tsuyoshi

Directors: Hashizume Shinichiro, Kotani Takayoshi, Kudo Takashi

Cast: Makita Aju, Takaishi Akari, Takasugi Mahiro, Kura Yuki, Saya, Kumada Rinka, Igashira Manami, Konno Mahiru, Magy, Kurashina Kana, Harada Taizo, Ichikawa Mikako, Higuchi Hina (guest star), Goto Junpei (guest star)

Synopsis: Kasamatsu Hotaru (Makita Aju), a fourth-year university student, has been failing terribly in her job hunt. She has a “natural enemy”. That person is Kagiya Miharu (Takaishi Akari) who attended elementary, junior high and high school with her and still lives near her house now. Miharu would have a sound argument for a fight in class and even overcome various accidents with originality and ingenuity. She always basked in a bright spotlight in front of Hotaru. Miharu was the person Hotaru wished she could be. Assuming Miharu’s personality as her own at the recruitment exam, she submits the application form which surprisingly gets through. Not knowing how to react, Hotaru continues to lie with a smile at the next interview, and the next one … … Three years go by. Hotaru has been working hard at a well-known major company after successfully obtaining a job offer. Then one day, she bumps into Miharu, the person whose application form she “borrowed”, on the street. Will the two of them be able to forgive each other?

Website: www.nhk.jp/p/ts/18199K68ZJ

Twitter: twitter.com/nhk_dramas

18 / 40 ~ Futari nara Yume mo Koi mo

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Tuesdays, 11 July – 12 September 2023

Station: TBS

Genre: Romance

Episodes: 10

Scriptwriters: Tatsui Yukari (Anata ni wa Watasanai, Mama to Papa ga Ikiru Riyu, Strawberry Night Series), Kimura Ryoko (Risou no Kareshi)

Directors: Fukuda Ryosuke, Matsuki Aya, Matsumoto Wakana, Mimura Rie, Katahira Nagisa

Cast: Fukuhara Haruka, Fukada Kyoko, Suzuka Oji, Uesugi Shuhei, Deguchi Natsuki, Nagasawa Itsuki, Yagi Yusei, Arashi Lina, Sylvia Grab, Mimura Rie, Matsumoto Wakana, Takashima Masahiro, Katahira Nagisa, Yasuda Ken

Synopsis: 18-year-old Nakagawa Arisu (Fukuhara Haruka) is an ordinary third-year high school student. As a result of her beloved mother’s influence, Arisu dreams of becoming a museum curator who is active overseas. She has been living with her father (Yasuda Ken) who is a firefighter, after her mother suddenly died of an illness when Arisu was 11 years old. Arisu is set to go on to study arts at a university, but her life completely changes due to her unexpected pregnancy. Meanwhile, Naruse Toko (Fukada Kyoko), a capable art specialist at a company that deals in contemporary art, is about to turn 40. She is devoted to her work and has not been in a romantic relationship in 10 years. The lives of these two women with different lifestyles and circumstances start to change significantly after a chance encounter.

Website: www.tbs.co.jp/1840_tbs

Twitter: twitter.com/1840_tbs

Usokon

Date: From 11.00 p.m., Tuesdays, 11 July 2023

Station: Fuji TV

Genre: Love comedy

Original Work: Usokon by Tokina Kiui

Scriptwriter: Hiruta Naomi (Shiro demo Kuro demo Nai Sekai de Panda wa Warau, Kore wa Keihi de Ochimasen!)

Directors: Yamaguchi Kento, Kimura Mahito

Theme Song: Honone to Tatemae by Sexy Zone

Cast: Kikuchi Fuma, Nagahama Neru

Synopsis: Natsume Takumi (Kikuchi Fuma), the very popular and competent CEO of a design office, and Sendo Yae (Nagahama Neru), who lost both her home and job at the same time, are childhood friends. They reunite as adults and unexpectedly get into a fake marriage of convenience with a time limit. Takumi has reasons for wanting people to think he is a married man and asks her to take on a part-time job as his fake wife for six months. However, Yae is actually his first love even though she thinks of him as nothing more than a childhood friend. He struggles awkwardly and earnestly to make her pay attention to him and find true love. While their marriage started as a sham, will the day come when his fake wife can become his real wife?

Website: www.ktv.jp/usokon

Twitter: twitter.com/kadora_11j

Barakamon

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Wednesdays, 12 July 2023

Station: Fuji TV

Original Work: Barakamon by Yoshino Satsuki

Scriptwriter: Aso Kumiko (#Izakaya Shinkansen, Lunch Gokon Tantei, Double Fantasy)

Director: Kono Keita

Theme Song: Moon by Perfume

Cast: Sugino Yosuke, Miyazaki Ririsa, Tanaka Minami, Tsuna Keito, Toyoshima Hana, Kondo Hana, Yamaguchi Kaori, Io Kazuki, Tanaka Min, Araki Towa, Nakao Akiyoshi, Endo Kenichi

Synopsis: Handa Seishu (Sugino Yosuke), a proud calligrapher who was born and raised in the city, is the heir to his father who heads a calligraphy school. He has made a name for himself as a young rising star and praised by the public. But when he experiences a setback, he ends up living alone on the Goto Islands in Nagasaki Prefecture. Just when Seishu thought that he can spend a peaceful time in solitude to practice his calligraphy, he finds himself thrown off by life alone in the unfamiliar countryside and socialising with free-spirited, individualistic islanders who visit him uninvited. Although he is often bewildered by island life and the unique customs, he grows as a person and a calligrapher little by little with the help and encouragement of the islanders despite the various troubles he gets tangled up in.

Website: www.fujitv.co.jp/barakamon

Twitter: twitter.com/barakamon_drama

Kocchi Muite yo, Mukai-kun

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Wednesdays, 12 July – 13 September 2023

Station: NTV

Genre: Romance

Episodes: 10

Original Work: Kocchi Muite yo, Mukai-kun by Nemu Yoko

Scriptwriter: Watanabe Mako (Muchaburi!: Watashi ga Shachou ni Naru nante, Koi wa Tsuzuku yo Dokomademo, Monro ga Shinda Hi)

Directors: Kusano Shogo, Shigeyama Yoshinori

Cast: Akaso Eiji, Ikuta Erika, Okayama Amane, Fujiwara Sakura, Moriwaki Kenji, Naito Shuichiro, Uechi Haruna, Iwai Kenshiro, Wakabayashi Jiei, Zaizen Naomi, Ichihara Hayato, Haru, Tanabe Momoko (guest star), Kumada Rinka (guest star)

Synopsis: 33-year-old Mukai Satoru (Akaso Eiji) is a capable employee of a t-shirt manufacturer in Tokyo. Despite his good looks and personality which naturally draws people to him, he has not had a girlfriend or been in a romantic relationship in 10 years. Satoru suddenly becomes conscious of his single status when his friend becomes a father and his younger sister (Fujiwara Sakura) gets married. Thinking that he has more leeway in his work now, he should be able to have a new romance if he wants to. Even though he is friendly with many women, Satoru’s all-out attempt to find love for the first time in a long while fails miserably. Could his thinking and the thinking of the women he knows be out of sync? Could his methods be wrong? His determination to find love, leads him on a quest to figure out his mistakes.

Website: www.ntv.co.jp/mukaikun

Twitter: twitter.com/mukaikun_ntv

The Days

Date: From 1 June

Network: Netflix Japan

Episodes: 8

Original Work: Shi no Fuchi o Mita Otoko ~ Yoshida Masao to Fukushima Daiichi Genpatsu by Kadota Ryusho

Scriptwriter: Masumoto Jun

Directors: Nishiura Masaki, Nakata Hideo

Cast: Yakusho Koji, Takenouchi Yutaka, Kobayashi Kaoru, Kohinata Fumiyo, Otoo Takuma, Mitsuishi Ken, Endo Kenichi, Ishida Yuriko, Izumisawa Yuki, Maruyama Tomomi, Suzuka Ouji, Fuchikami Yasushi, Ogi Shigemitsu, Takahashi Kazuya, Sako Yoshi, Musaka Naomasa, Denden, Fukikoshi Mitsuru

Synopsis: On 11 March 2011, a massive 9.0 earthquake with its epicentre off the Sanriku coast struck the Tohoku region. The resulting tsunami devastated eastern Japan. It also triggered a crisis that mankind had never experienced before. Four reactors at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant located some 225 km north of Tokyo started to meltdown at the same time as cooling systems failed and accumulated hydrogen caused a chain reaction of explosions. Thrust into the worst possible situation, the government and the plant’s operator TEPCO were forced to take urgent action and make critical decisions. How did those on the frontline who had to deal with conflicting instructions from the government and head office race against time and do their best to stop the reactors from going out of control?

Website: www.netflix.com/jp/title/81233755

Twitter: twitter.com/NetflixJP

Preview: The Days CM

Rikon Shiyou yo!

Date: From 22 June 2023

Network: Netflix Japan

Genre: Romantic comedy

Episodes: 9

Scriptwriters: Kudo Kankuro (Ore no Ie no Hanashi, Kangoku no Ohimesama, Yutori desu ga Nani ka Series), Oishi Shizuka (Ano Toki Kisu Shite Okeba, Koisuru Hahatachi, Dairenai)

Directors: Kaneko Fuminori, Fukuda Ryosuke, Sakagami Takuya

Cast: Matsuzaka Toori, Naka Riisa, Nishikido Ryo, Itaya Yuka, Oda Risa, Kamio Fuju, Shoji Yusuke, Moriya Rena, Takagishi Hiroyuki, Maehara Ko, Omi Toshinori, Ikeda Narushi, Yamamoto Koji, Takashima Reiko, Takeshita Keiko, Furuta Arata

Synopsis: Shoji Taishi (Matsuzaka Toori) is a new third-generation lawmaker who comes from a family of politicians and had a sheltered upbringing. The womanising and not particularly intelligent Taishi and his actress wife Kurosawa Yui (Naka Riisa), who got her big break through a drama series, have been married for five years. While they act like a happily married couple for the sake of their work and public image, their marriage has already broken down. Taishi and Yui barely have a conversation except when live streaming on social media and do not even see each other at home. Although they have grown disenchanted in their marriage, they cannot get divorced immediately due to pressure from their families and endorsement deals. The couple have no choice but to unite with the unshakeable goal of breaking up, but … …

Website: www.netflix.com/jp/title/81476361

Twitter: twitter.com/NetflixJP

Preview: Rikon Shiyou yo! CM

Mitarai-ke, Enjou Suru

Date: From 13 July 2023

Network: Netflix

Genre: Revenge

Episodes: 8

Original Work: Mitarai-ke, Enjou Suru by Fujisawa Moyashi

Scriptwriter: Kaneko Arisa (Pending Train, Kikazaru Koi ni wa Riyuu ga Atte, Koi wa Tsuzuku yo Doko made mo)

Director: Hirakawa Yuichiro

Theme Song: Carnival by Vaundy

Cast: Nagano Mei, Kudo Asuka, Nakagawa Taishi, Tsunematsu Yuri, Kitano Kii, Hamada Mari, Konishi Sakurako, Kichise Michiko, Oikawa Mitsuhiro, Suzuki Kyoka

Synopsis: Both her home and her family were stolen from her. The house of the wealthy Mitarai family, which runs a hospital, was burned down in an unfortunate incident. The wife who caused the accident in a moment of carelessness, knelt in front of the burning house in repentance. 13 years later, Murata Anzu (Nagano Mei) heads to a new customer – the Mitarai family as their new housekeeper. She is received by the beautiful and intimidating second wife Makiko (Suzuki Kyoka). Despite Makiko’s tough standards, Anzu manages to secure her employment. She has a motive for infiltrating the Mitarai family.

Website: www.netflix.com/jp/title/81511743

Twitter: twitter.com/NetflixJP

Preview: Mitarai-ke, Enjou Suru CM

Shumatsu Tabi no Gokui ~ Fuufutte Sonna Kantan ja nai Mono

Date: From 1.00 a.m., Thursdays, 6 July 2023

Station: TV Tokyo

Scriptwriters: Ito Nanoha (Shoumonai Bokura no Renairon, Uketsuke no Jo, Youtuber ni Musume wa Yaran!), Brazily Anne Yamada (Hyouchakusha, Yokai Sharehouse, Silent Voice Series)

Directors: Aoki Tatsuya, Matsumoto Taku,

Cast: Mizuki Arisa, Yoshizawa Hisashi, Hinagata Akiko, Maruyama Tomomi, Muraoka Nozomi, Hiratsuka Hina, Moritaka Ai, Fujishiro Taichi

Synopsis: Career woman Yabuki Masumi (Mizuki Arisa) and her husband Jin (Yoshizawa Hisashi) are both absolute workaholics. It has been about 10 years since they got married but as they spend most of their lives at work, they do not have much time to talk to or see each other on weekdays. On weekends, either one of them is out playing golf or tired. Although they live in the same space, what makes them husband and wife? Half a year ago, Masumi made a proposal to her husband to go on weekend trips together. While these trips are meant for them to get away from bustle of city life and recover from the daily grind, they will have to be together the whole time when they travel even if he does not like it. Her main purpose is for them to frankly say what is on their minds and reaffirm their values as a couple. Jin readily agrees. On their 10th anniversary, Masumi and Jin start their weekend trips together and make up for the couple time that they had lost.

Website: www.tv-tokyo.co.jp/shumatsutabi

Twitter: twitter.com/tx_shumatsutabi

Hayabusa Shobodan

Date: From 9.00 p.m., Thursdays, 13 July – 14 September 2023

Station: TV Asahi

Genre: Mystery

Episodes: 9

Original Work: Hayabusa Shobodan by Ikeido Jun

Scriptwriter: Kosaka Takafumi (Mahiru no Akuma, Genkai Danchi, Mutsuu)

Directors: Tsunehiro Jota, Yamamoto Daisuke

Cast: Nakamura Tomoya, Kawaguchi Haruna, Mitsushima Shinnosuke, Furukawa Yuta, Okabe Takashi, Kajihara Zen, Hashimoto Jun, Yamamoto Koji, Namase Katsuhisa, Maro Akaji, Muraoka Nozomi, Kobayashi Ryoko, Fukuda Tenkyu, Ichinose Wataru, Kaneda Akio, Owada Baku

Synopsis: Mystery writer Mishima Taro (Nakamura Tomoya) won the Akechi Shogoro Prize five years ago. However, he is currently in a slump. He has lost confidence after a reduction in the first-run print each time he releases a new book as well as the harsh online reviews of his work. One day, Taro visits the Hayabusa district, a mountainous settlement, to determine the state of the house that he had inherited from his late father. He is captivated by the lush nature of his father’s hometown and decides to move to this area. Just when he thought that he would be able to live a peaceful life free from the stress of the city, he gets embroiled in a series of arson cases after, joining the local volunteer firefighting team (Mitsushima Shinnosuke, Okabe Takashi, Kajihara Zen, Hashimoto Jun, Namase Katsuhisa) to protect Hayabusa, and even encounters mysterious incidents including the suspicious deaths of residents. As Taro begins to search for the truth, what emerges is a huge conspiracy lurking in the village.

Website: www.tv-asahi.co.jp/hayabusa-syobodan

Twitter: twitter.com/hayabusa_ex2023

Kono Subarashiki Sekai

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Thursdays, 20 July – 14 September 2023

Station: Fuji TV

Genre: Comedy

Episodes: 9

Scriptwriter: Karasuma Maruta

Directors: Hirano Shin, Yamauchi Daisuke

Theme Song: what’s your message？ by Oda Kazumasa

Cast: Wakamura Mayumi, Kimura Yoshino, Makita Sports, Taira Yuna, Nakagawa Daisuke, Nagase Riko, Marui Wan, Tokito Yuki, Yatabe Shun, Nekoze Tsubaki, Satoi Kenta, Nishimura Masahiko, Sawamura Ikki

Synopsis: Housewife Hamaoka Taeko (Wakamura Mayumi) lives with her husband Yoichi (Makita Sports) but there is no more love between them. She is preoccupied with bringing up their son Akira (Nakagawa Daisuke) as well as her part-time job at a supermarket, and has no hobbies. Both Yoichi and Akira disdainfully think she knows nothing about society. One day, Taeko is approached by Saijo Hayato from the famous actress Wakana Kinuyo’s management agency. He wants her to impersonate Kinuyo, had disappeared overseas after a weekly magazine’s expose, and attend a press conference to address the scandal because her face and also voice are strikingly similar to Kinuyo’s. Taeko’s immediate reaction is to turn down this outrageous request. But the big paycheck she would get for standing in for Kinuyo is never far from her mind. She eventually succumbs to Saijo’s persuasion and the monetary reward and meets Higa Riko (Kimura Yoshino), the CEO of Kinuyo’s agency, as well as Kinuyo’s husband Mizuta Natsuo (Sawamura Ikki) on the day of the press conference. Now she has to keep her masquerade a secret from her family while playing the actress feared as a diabolical woman by the people around her.

Website: www.fujitv.co.jp/subaseka

Twitter: twitter.com/subaseka_fujitv

Shikkou!! ~ Inu to Watashi to Shikkoukan

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Thursdays, 4 July – 12 September 2023

Station: TV Asahi

Genre: Comedy

Episodes: 9

Original Work: Shikkoukan Monogatari by Ogawa Junpei

Scriptwriter: Omori Mika (Seiten o Tsuke, Mikaiketsu no Onna Series, Asa ga Kita)

Directors: Tamura Naoki, Hoshino Kazunari, Takahashi Takashi

Cast: Ito Sairi, Nakajima Kento, Kasamatsu Sho, First Summer Uika, Rokkaku Seiji, Sugawara Daikichi, Komai Ren, Kaito Sora, Nakagawa Kureha, Moro Morooka, Miyazaki Yoshiko, Itaya Yuka, Watanabe Ikkei, Katsumura Masanobu, Oda Yuji

Synopsis: Yoshino Hikari (Ito Sairi) became an enforcement officer by chance. She had quit working at a credit union and got her dream job working with pets after moving to Tokyo on a whim. However, the company goes into administration and declares bankruptcy one day. Hikari suddenly loses her job. But Obara Itsuki (Oda Yuji), the enforcement officer responsible for enforcing the process of seizing and confiscating assets, money, goods and property, recognises some ability that she has and this opens up a new path for her as an enforcement assistant. Obara who is really bad with dogs, had honed in on her ability to be extremely well liked by them. And so, Hikari and Obara form a tenuous partnership that no one could have imagined.

Website: www.tv-asahi.co.jp/shikkou

Twitter: twitter.com/shikkou_tvasahi

Kanojotachi no Hanzai

Date: From 11.59 p.m., Thursdays, 20 July 2023

Station: NTV

Genre: Suspense

Original Work: Kanojotachi no Hanzai by Yokozeki Dai

Scriptwriters: Tanabe Shigenori (Boyfriend Kourin, Ore no Kawaii wa Mousugu Shouhi Kigen!?, Konintodoke ni Han o Oshita dake desu ga), Obayashi Rieko (Sister, Junai Dissonance, Rabu Kome no Okite), Taniguchi Junichiro (Sensei no Otoriyose, Shiro to Kiiro, Universal Koukokusha)

Directors: Kikuchi Takeo, Takahashi Natsuki

Cast: Fukagawa Mai, Maeda Atsuko, Ishii Anna, Maiguma Katsuya, Sato Honami, Nomaguchi Toru, Asakura Aki, Yamashita Yorie, Toyama Toshiya, Suzuki Kosuke, Suzuki Yuka

Synopsis: Attractive and stylish Himura Mayumi (Fukagawa Mai) handles public relations at a large apparel company. She is often wooed by guys but she does not have a boyfriend right now. As the people around her gradually get married, Mayumi assumes she will be able to get married at anytime too. However, when she seeks marriage in an attempt to run away from a demotion at work, she does not get the outcome she had hoped for and feels very frustrated. Housewife Jinno Yukari (Maeda Atsuko) married Tomoaki (Maiguma Katsuya), a doctor who is a good catch, and lives in an exclusive neighbourhood. But she feels extremely lonely as she cannot conceive, her husband treats her like a maid and there is no one around her that she can open up to. Rookie detective Kumazawa Riko (Ishii Anna) used to work at a police box and her dream to be assigned to the Criminal Affairs Division recently came true. She is full of ideals and motivation despite her lack of experience. However, she frets due to her sense of responsibility and seeks justice. These three women with different backgrounds seem to have nothing in common until a lady’s disappearance leads their lives in unexpected directions. Their secrets and unknown sides are revealed one after another, and a perfect crime starts to come apart, exposing the truth of the case. All they wanted was ordinary happiness … …

Website: www.ytv.co.jp/kanojohanzai

Twitter: twitter.com/kanojo_drama

Preview: Kanojotachi no Hanzai CM

Black Postman

Date: From 8.00 p.m., Fridays, 18 August 2023

Station: TV Tokyo

Genre: Suspense

Scriptwriters: Terada Toshio (Doctor X Seasons 2 – 5, Kumo no Kaidan, Egao no Hosoku), Kanome Keiko (Fuufu ga Kowareru Toki, Kei x Yaku, Gohoubi Gohan), Takei Aya (Junai Dissonance, Pareto no Gosan, Sousa Kaigi wa Living de!)

Directors: Gonno Hajime, Suzuki Kosuke, Motohashi Keita, Kakihara Toshiyuki

Cast: Tanaka Kei, Shida Mirai, Takahashi Maryjun, Hirayama Hiroyuki, Kanazawa Miho, Kondo Haruna, Hamao Noritaka, Hori Joe, Masana Bokuzo, Sugimoto Tetta, Koizumi Kotaro

Synopsis: There was once a post box that was created for children who were victimised by adults. It was a mysterious post box. If a message was posted, the Devil of Neverland would punish the bad adults for the children. However, the “Devil” suddenly vanished after an incident. 10 years went by. Former postman Soejima Rikiya (Tanaka Kei) who now works at a hospice receives a mysterious letter telling him that the Devil of Neverland still exists. For some reason, this letter makes him decide to return to his previous job at the post office in his hometown. It coincides with a new development connected with the Devil of Neverland. A piece of paper bearing the words “Devil of Neverland’s Second Coming” is found in the mouth of a corpse that was strangled to death at a riverbed. Rikiya gets embroiled in Devil of Neverland serial killings that are occurring in the town.

Website: www.tv-tokyo.co.jp/blackpostman

Twitter: twitter.com/tx_dorama8

Trillion Game

Date: From 10.00 p.m., Fridays, 14 July – 15 September 2023

Station: TBS

Genre: Corporate

Episodes: 10

Original Work: Trillion Game by Inagaki Riichiro

Scriptwriter: Habara Daisuke (Chimudondon, Showa Genroku Rakugo Shinjuu, Godan)

Director: Murao Yoshiaki

Cast: Meguro Ren, Sano Hayato, Imada Rio, Fukumoto Riko, Takezai Terunosuke, Kikkawa Koji, Kunimura Jun

Synopsis: With his exceptional communication skills and ability to win the hearts and minds of people, Tennoji Haru (Meguro Ren) is popular with men and women of all ages. He appears to be an easygoing person but is actually a calculative, dangerous and tremendously ambitious man who will not stop at bad things. Haru abruptly withdraws midway through a ceremony for prospective employees by the long-established Dragon Bank, the country’s largest IT company led by Kokuryu Kazuma (Kunimura Jun). Together with his former junior high school classmate Taira Manabu (Sano Hayato), a computer geek with remarkable programming skills who failed to get a job at Dragon Bank, they set up a company called Trillion Game without any start-up capital or business plan. Scheming to swallow up Dragon Bank and earn a trillion dollars which will allow them to obtain everything in the world, Haru and Manabu seek out talent necessary for the company’s growth. Despite the obstacles thrown in their way by the well-capitalised Dragon Bank, they bounce back using their wits, bluffs and proven skills.

Website: www.tbs.co.jp/trilliongame_tbs

Twitter: twitter.com/trillion_tbs

Drop

Date: From 11.00 p.m., Fridays, 2 June – 4 August 2023

Network: WOWOW
